column2: (verb) to give something to someone as their share of a total amount, to use in a particular way
(noun) a substance or product that can be traded, bought, or sold // a valuable quality
(verb) to gradually become less, worse, or lower
(noun) the value of a company, divided into many equal parts owned by the shareholders, or one of the equal parts into which the value of a company is divided
(noun) a general, continuous increase in prices

(noun) material made of threads of rope, string, wine or plastic with spaces between them, allowing gas, liquid or samll objetcs to go trough, or an object made with this material that is used to limit the  movement of something
(adv) If you express an amount per capita, you mean that amount for each person
(verb) to control something by making it work in a particular way
(noun) money given as part of the cost of something, to help or encourage it to happen
(adj) real and not imaginary; able to be shown, touched, or experienced
